title: When you are support, and your ADC hovers Vayne

replies.body: She's gonna be free this week too. Welcome to support hell week.

If Vayne is "hell week". . .

What does that make Kalista?
Seven circles, my friend.

{{champion:90}} Yo.
Ever heard of the super devil?
Well,there is a Super Teemo skin.
Atleast Kalista can save you, Vayne just...goes in, regardless of the danger.
At least Vayne goes in alone. . . Kalista just kinda drags you along.

You may pull me in to try and engage, but I decide where I go from there.

And you... are getting left behind.
Gotta see those q flash condemn misses combo

http://cdn.nextimpulsesports.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Thats-so-evil-t.jpg
evil laughter intensifies
Out of my experience as support, {{champion:15}} players are the type that aren't really toxic but have no idea how to play whatsoever.

Well, actually Sivir is the ADC that looks most appealing to people who can't play marksmen. Everyone told me to play Ashe back then, but I always fed so hard on Ashe. Sivir has a greater margin for error but most non-ADC players still suck on her. I've gotten used to the fact that I can't play any ADC except Ezreal, but that insight took me a year. I assume that most Sivir players are actually mid/top players (not counting toxic Yasuos, they go Yasuo ADC) who want to give ADC a try or were forced into the role.
Sivir standing in Morg's binding. Then she turns on spellshield just to ensure there'll be a vicious cycle.
This week in a nutshell: http://leaguememe.com/uploads/league/8830682174.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WoYOxcAbUuY

The sad part is that I like vayne players.

I main soraka so my favorite adcs to support are lucian, vayne and draven.

I also mute everyone as soon as they say anything remotely insulting or blaming. 

:3
I like vayne mains, as soon as I see one I get to roam mid and top as support.

you... you're why Hitler did what he did.
That's actually my face when my support hovers bard {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

yep.

Me: Hey bard we almost have them corner...bard? Bard? Where'd you go?
Me: (You have been slain)
Bard: Sorry man, i could hear the chimes calling me mid lane.
I know the feeling, time to save people with condemn.

Ugg my last ranked game went like this. I was {{champion:25}} and my adc went vayne. Of all the adcs in the game vayne is probably my least or at least top 3 least favorite to lane with. Now to be fair.... i was doing really really terrible. I missed a fun ton of snares and idk i really haven't felt like playing the game since it went that bad.... but this {{champion:67}} had the nerve to say "morg your tilting me hard". Which I replied "wellll your muted" and muted them. I realize I was doing really poorly but right after the vayne said that he/she jumps into a fight 3v1 and dies horribly. They continued to do that a couple of times during the game. I see later it was the vanes second time playing vayne in ranked this season and their first game went equally as terrible. 

Few things to learn:

1. you gain nothing from yelling at your teammates. All you are doing is tilting them.
2. you probably are doing some really dumb shit as well but the other player(s) are nicer or smarter and is not saying anything
3. As this post indicates, not all supports love playing with you {{champion:67}} gosu wannabes. 
4. I don't care if you were a tier higher elo than me last season... there is a reason we are currently the same elo so stfu and play.

Enemy Vaynes are always predatory gods who can cc, kite, and deal massive dmg 
Friendly Vaynes are lolfeeders who tumble into skillshots

HA!

"Friendly" Vaynes XD

This week on Summoner's Rift

"Reports against supports tremendously shoot up"

Let's talk to the ~~people~~ person who makes these reports

{{champion:67}} :Noob support doesn't help me 1 v 5, so I reported him/her. 

"Why did you 1 v 5?"

{{champion:67}} : i saw a Vayne do it online, so I'm pretty sure I can do it.

"Did you practice Vayne at all ?"

{{champion:67}} : No. It doesn't matter that I don't have any practice on her. I should be able to 1 v 5 on this champion by default, so if I fail, obviously its my supports fault. Doesn't matter if they don't have mana, have their spells on cooldown, or have the wrong type of support. IT IS THE SUPPORT'S FAULT. Now let me get back to my Bronze 5 game.

depends on the person playing vayne, a friend of mine is a Vayne main. and he carries almost every game.
even when all lanes get fed.
Then I pick {{champion:223}} and pray she doesn't tumble out of my mouth into a turret.
Cancer week. Gotta respect dam skills and mechanics. Btw, vayne main here

When you're ADC and you're Support hovers Bard...
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

This Jokes getting old, but its still funny. seriously though, I'm biased, I've basically only seen really good Vaynes who had no idea how to manage their lane.

(Bless you supports, for helping one Vayne get to late game.)

it's not a joke, most random Vayne players are awful, Told my buddy that if I'm support and we have a random that picks {{champion:67}} I'm dodging. either way ill lose points, might as well not lose my sanity while I'm at it.
